source.b5cd0ca9:
from scipy import stats
from scipy.stats import ttest_ind
print(ttest_ind(df_India["daily_vaccinations"],df_India["daily_vaccinations_raw"],equal_var=False))
print(stats.t.ppf(.025,76))
source.e8014210:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
sns.lineplot(data=df_India,x="date",y="daily_vaccinations",marker='d',markersize=20,color='k')
plt.title("Vaccination line of India")
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.show()

source.e845f771:
cols = ['total_vaccinations', 'iso_code', 'vaccines','total_vaccinations_per_hundred']
vac_amt = df.groupby('country')[cols].max().sort_values('total_vaccinations_per_hundred',ascending=False).dropna(subset=["total_vaccinations"])
vac_amt=vac_amt.iloc[:10]
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
sns.barplot(data=vac_amt,x="total_vaccinations_per_hundred",y=vac_amt.index)
plt.title("Top ten country with vaccination per houndred")
plt.show()
source.8f9c417b:
cols=['total_vaccinations', 'iso_code', 'vaccines','daily_vaccinations_per_million']
amt_mlm=df.groupby('country')[cols].max().sort_values('daily_vaccinations_per_million',ascending=False)
amt_mlm=amt_mlm.iloc[:10]
plt.figure(figsize=(10,15))
sns.barplot(data=amt_mlm,x="daily_vaccinations_per_million",y=amt_mlm.index)
plt.title("country with people Vaccinated per million")
plt.show()

                    color="vaccines",

source.6496f4bb:
From the above analysis and visualizations, we can conclude that:

1. In Gibraltar the rate of giving vaccine to the people is fastest these is probably beacause of the low popoluation and also for low square km area and maybe also because of well developesd infrastructure.
2. The country which has highest vaccinated people is USA because it is well developed , has a great infrastructure and hospitality .  This is followed by China , United Kingdom and so on.
3. Moderna, Pfizer/BioNTech is the most used vaccine in the world.
4. The top 10 countries with vaccinated people for hundred also holds a position on the graph of vaccinated people per million which is showing that they are vaccinating the people all over the country at a rate greater than the well developed country.

source.0f9a05e4: As L.O.S is less then p value we accept null hypothesis . That is daily_vaccination is equal to the daily_vaccinations_raw
source.f423e4c9: # WHICH VACCINE IS USED IN WHICH COUNTRY
source.8acfe93f: Lets see whether the daily_vaccination is equal or not to the daily_vacinations_raw. For these we will perform a hypithesis testing using t statistics where H0:u1=u2 and Ha:u1!=u2 . And as it is two-tailed t test Level of Significance is 0.05/2=0.025 . n is 76(39+39-2)
